intro: Cryptantha confusa, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, oval pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cryptantha confusa is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
